facts.text: Three brothers, Ramakrishna (83), Narayanaswamy (79), Mahadeva (69); father died in 1908 leaving 10 acres of land and debts.
Ramakrishna became Karta; repaid debts; Karnam in Narasingampettai from 1902; acquired 25 acres for joint family 1911-1931.
1927 Ramakrishna transferred to Vepatthur till 1930; son Venkatarama succeeded as Karnam.
1931-1946 properties acquired in name of Venkatarama, wife Mangalathammal, grandson Mahalingam, Mangalathammal's brother Raja Ayyar; investments in their names.
Narayanaswamy Vakil's clerk in Kumbakonam from 1910; Mahadeva doctor, Sub-Assistant Surgeon; both acquired separate properties from earnings.
Strained feelings in 1930s; Mahadeva demanded partition; no court action till mother died early 1945 at 90.
12 Dec 1946 Narayanaswamy notice claiming 25 acres + later properties + Rs.25,000 cash/benami as joint; demanded 1/3 share, accounts for 3 years.
Ramakrishna reply 1 Dec 1946? (text says Dec 1, 1946 but after notice?); joint only 10+25 acres.
1 Feb 1947 Narayanaswamy suit for partition/accounts; defendants: Ramakrishna (D1), Mahadeva (D2), Venkatarama (D3), Mangalathammal (D4), Raja Ayyar (D5), Mahalingam (D6), minors (D7,D8).
Plaintiff claimed properties in Sch A, A1, B,B1,B2,C,C1,C2,D + movables A2 as joint family acquired by Karta Ramakrishna; 1/3 share, accounts 3 years.
Mahadeva (D2) supported but for 1940-43 claimed plaintiff collected income, liable for accounts; added properties.
D1: Management by mother till 1940, then plaintiff till 1945; only Sch A 34.58 acres + some movables joint; counterclaimed plaintiff's properties joint.
D4: Properties in her name from husband's gifts from own earnings.
D3: Own earnings as Karnam; for son's also own.
D5: Own money.

Trial Court (Sub Judge): Ramakrishna managed as Karta from 1908; Rs.14,000 family funds by 1931; Sch A,A1,B,B1,C1,C2,D + item5 B2 joint (except A1 given to sister); mortgages joint except some D3; preliminary decree, accounts 3 years pre-suit + post.
D1 appeal to Madras HC; plaintiff cross-appeal on Kumbakonam house.

HC: Allowed plaintiff appeal (Kumbakonam house separate); D1 appeal allowed: Ramakrishna saved enough from own post-1930; no Rs.14k family; only Sch A+D joint; no nucleus shown for others; accounts from 12 Dec 1946.
SC appeal by plaintiff Narayanaswamy.
By 1931 Ramakrishna had Rs.15,000 from own earnings (Karnam salary paddy, banana, litigation reward Rs.2500, document writing fees).
1911-1931 family purchases Rs.20,000; family income insufficient alone; borrowings for purchases.
1931-1939 family income ~Rs.15,624 crops + Rs.1,100 mortgage = Rs.16,724; expenses >Rs.18,000 incl D sch Rs.6,500.
1940-1945 plaintiff managed, collected income; Ramakrishna only D sch ~Rs.500/yr net.
1941-1942 acquisitions: no nucleus after prior deficit.
1945-1946 B2 properties: Venkatarama own earnings as Karnam 15 yrs; no nucleus shown.

legal_issues.text: Whether properties acquired post-1931 in names of Ramakrishna's wife, son, grandson were joint family properties or self-acquisitions, given alleged family nucleus.
Extent of Karta's accounting liability on partition.

petitioner_arguments.text: Acquisitions in names of D1's wife/son/grandson with funds from D1; if joint family had sufficient nucleus at acquisition dates, presume joint family funds; D1 must rebut.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Presumption if sufficient nucleus: Amritlal Sen v. Surath Lal Sen; Appalaswami v. Suryanarayanamurthy

petitioner_arguments.text: Karta must establish assets for partition; enquiry into what property consists of.

respondent_arguments.text: Post-1930 acquisitions/investments from Ramakrishna's own savings (Rs.15,000 by 1931); no family nucleus; management by mother/plaintiff 1940-45.
Properties in D3-D6 names from own earnings.

court_reasoning.text: Legal position settled: if joint family sufficient nucleus at acquisition, presume joint unless contrary shown; here funds advanced by Ramakrishna.
court_reasoning.key_observation: But no sufficient nucleus post-1931: 1931 Rs.15k own; 1911-31 purchases Rs.20k needed borrowings; 1931-39 income Rs.16.7k < expenses Rs.18k+.

court_reasoning.text: 1940-45 plaintiff managed/ collected income; only D sch to Ramakrishna ~Rs.1500 1940-42 < prior deficit; no nucleus for 1941-42 buys.
Karta not liable for past accounts absent fraud; but must show existing assets; enquiry per facts.

holdings.text: No sufficient joint family nucleus for post-1931 acquisitions in D1 branch names; only Sch A & D joint family properties.
High Court conclusions correct; properties not liable to partition beyond A & D.

precedents_cited.case_name: Amritlal Sen v. Surath Lal Sen
precedents_cited.relevance: Presumption of joint family property if sufficient nucleus at acquisition.
Presumption of joint family property if sufficient nucleus at acquisition.
Karta liable only for existing assets on partition; court enquiry into property composition.

outcome.summary: Supreme Court upheld Madras High Court: only Schedules A and D properties joint family; no sufficient nucleus for other acquisitions; accounts from notice date; plaintiff's appeal dismissed.
outcome.relief_granted: Partition limited to Schedules A and D; accounts as per High Court.

key_quotes.text: The legal position is well settled that if in fact at the date of acquisition of a particular property the joint family had sufficient nucleus for acquiring it, the property in the name of any member of the joint family should be presumed to be acquired from out of family funds...
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: States key presumption applied throughout reasoning.

key_quotes.text: When we consider that the joint family nucleus has been more than quadrupled, it is difficult to see what grievance the younger coparceners really have...
key_quotes.speaker: lower_court
key_quotes.significance: High Court observation on fairness of outcome upheld by SC.
